ossj.qos.ri.pm.threshold.adapter
Class ThresholdMonitorEntityBean

java.lang.Object
  ossj.qos.ri.pm.threshold.adapter.ThresholdMonitorEntityBean
All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.ejb.EnterpriseBean, javax.ejb.EntityBean, java.io.Serializable
public class ThresholdMonitorEntityBean
extends java.lang.Object
implements javax.ejb.EntityBean

A container-managed persistent entity bean.

Data stored by this bean: 

 thresholdMonitorPrimaryKey   String          CHAR(32), NOT NULL
 thresholdMonitorKey          Serializable    SERIALIZE
 thresholdMonitorValue        Serializable    SERIALIZE
 thresholdMonitorStatus       int             INTEGER
 performanceMonitorPrimaryKey String          CHAR(32)
 performanceMonitorKey        Serializable    SERIALIZE
 thresholdAlarmPrimaryKey     String          CHAR(32)
 thresholdAlarmNotificationId long            LONGINT
The thresholdMonitorPrimaryKey and performanceMonitorKey is used to make it easier to search the entities.

Author:
Henrik Lindstrom, Ericsson
See Also:
ThresholdMonitorBean, Serialized Form

ejbLoad

public void ejbLoad()
Called from the Container. Updates the entity bean instance to reflect the current value stored in the database. Since this is a container-managed persistence it can be left blank. The EJB container will automatically load the data in the subclass.

Specified by:
ejbLoad in interface javax.ejb.EntityBean

ejbStore

public void ejbStore()
Called from the container. Updates the database to reflect the current values of this in-memory entity bean instance representation. Since this is a container-managed persistence it can be left blank. The EJB container will automatically save the data in the subclass.

Specified by:
ejbStore in interface javax.ejb.EntityBean

ejbCreate

public java.lang.String ejbCreate(javax.oss.pm.threshold.ThresholdMonitorKey thresholdMonitorKey,
                                  javax.oss.pm.threshold.ThresholdMonitorValue value,
                                  javax.oss.pm.measurement.PerformanceMonitorKey performanceMonitorKey)
                           throws javax.ejb.CreateException
This is the initialization method that corresponds to the create() method in the home interface. When the client calls the home object's create() method, the home object then calls this ejbCreate() method. The bean's fields are initialized with the arguments passed from the client, so that the container can create the corresponding database entries in the subclass after this method completes.

The ThresholdMonitorPrimaryKey and PerformanceMonitorPrimaryKey is extracted from the ThresholdMonitorKey and PerformanceMonitorKey.

Parameters:
thresholdMonitorKey - the primary key for this threshold monitor
value - the threshold monitor value
Returns:
primary key for threshold monitor
Throws:
javax.ejb.CreateException

ejbPostCreate

public void ejbPostCreate(javax.oss.pm.threshold.ThresholdMonitorKey thresholdMonitorKey,
                          javax.oss.pm.threshold.ThresholdMonitorValue value,
                          javax.oss.pm.measurement.PerformanceMonitorKey performanceMonitorKey)
                   throws javax.ejb.CreateException
Called after ejbCreate(). Now it is possible for the bean to retrieve its EJBObject from its context, and pass it as a 'this' argument.

Parameters:
thresholdMonitorKey - the primary key for this threshold monitor
value - the threshold monitor value
Throws:
javax.ejb.CreateException
